by Cynthia Boyd, MD, MPH While the prevalence of having multiple chronic conditions, or multimorbidity, increases with age, the numbers of people living with multimorbidity of all ages is increasing. Forty-eight percent of older adults have 3 or more chronic conditions. Many people living with multiple chronic conditions are less than 60 years of age… Continue reading...
